newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan money rates end sharply higher.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan money rates end sharply higher.

text.p: Taiwan's money rates finished sharply higher on Tuesday as most banks adopted a cautious policy on worry of tightening liquidity in the banking system, dealers said.

The overnight interbank rate closed at 6.340 percent against Monday's 6.098 close, well outside the central bank's 5.0-5.5 percent target zone, with 30-day commercial paper rising to 6.35-6.40 against 6.00-6.10.
Routine monthly payroll demand and money demand ahead of Friday's holiday would keep the money rates at current high levels in the near term, dealers said.

The bond market was stuck in a narrow-range consolidation. Dealers said they expected thin trading interest in government bonds as long as Taiwan's stocks were rebounding from a big late March correction.
